description:
The Soul Nebula spans roughly 100 light years across at 6,500 ly away. It doesn't quite fit into my smaller 183 sensor, but I enjoyed the additional detail from this camera's tiny pixels.

I experimented with tone mapping this time, moving Ha to be more towards the red and OIII towards the green. For anyone curious, the pixel math expression used was:
R: Ha*.45+SII*.55
G: Ha*.6+OIII*.4
B: OIII

Thank you for checking out the result!

---------------------------
AstroPixelProcessor
---------------------------
Stacked with default settings except LNC set to 2nd degree with 3 iterations.

--------------
Pixinsight
--------------
1. Deconvolution
2. TGV Denoise & MMT (Jon Rista method) used for noise reduction.
3. STF Stretch applied.
4. Temporary star removal for tone mapping.
5. PixelMath SHO combine.
6. Small 30% SNCR applied to remove slight green cast.
7. Re-add stars back.
8. Applied various curves/masks to enhance contrast.

---------------
Photoshop
---------------
1. Spot cleanup of small over-saturated stars.
2. Smart Sharpening of just the details in IC 1871
title: IC1848 - IC1871 - Soul Nebula
